comments.author: alekonko
comments.body:
Hi @TravisEz13, 

 i don't use snap but rpm (powershell-6.2.3-1.rhel.7.x86_64), but I think you can take as an example what I have done.
The only note in my case is to indicate the right Icon file path, I had to download it as it is not provided by the indicated rpm.

Ah, given the age of the issue maybe you had already solved it :)

Powershell-launcher.desktop 

```config
[Desktop Entry]
Categories=ConsoleOnly;System
Comment[en_US]=PowerShell Core
Comment[it_IT]=PowerShell Core
Comment=PowerShell Core
Exec=pwsh
GenericName[en_US]=Powershell
GenericName=Powershell
Icon=/usr/local/share/icons/powershell.png
MimeType=
Name=PowerShell
Path=
StartupNotify=true
Terminal=true
TerminalOptions=
Type=Application
X-DBUS-ServiceName=
X-DBUS-StartupType=
X-KDE-SubstituteUID=false
X-KDE-Username=
```
bye
Alessandro
